results.title: Towards a modern Europe: the Renaissance
results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
Explains and illustrates the transition from the Middle Ages to the Renaissance, including the principles of the new study and attitudes in art, architecture and scholarship

results.title: The Romans
results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
Presents the origins, growth and collapse of the Roman Empire. Describes how the Romans imitated the greek ideal of the city state and how they expanded over a period of 400 years, emerging as the ruling force of the world. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: An Age of Revolutions. Great Britain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
Revolution, nationalism, liberty, war, and industrialisation, were the main themes in the history of Europe from 1789 to 1870. This looks at the effects of the two main revolutions in this time, on the whole of Europe. The French Revolution brought new ideas and politics, and the Industrial Revolution brought new wealth and motives, and an urban industrialised society

results.title: Perceptual learning (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “An Introduction to Psychology”.
Traces the different approaches adopted in research into the way in which a child learns to coordinate his actions in relation to the world around him. Looks at a number of famous experiments including the Visual Cliff, Inverted Prism and dark-reared animals. Also demonstrates some of the perceptual processes on which they are based.

results.title: Communicating effectively
results.creator_credit: Caryl Wickman, Nancy Evelyn and Sandler Institutional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “An Essential Skill for Job Success”.
Explores communications techniques, including both verbal and nonverbal skills, and stresses the importance of effective communication.

group.title: An Essential Skill for Job Success

results.title: The Effects of fire
results.brief_description: This proposed public imaging piece shows a series of close up portraits of domestic objects being burnt to abstraction, creating an inventory of domestic combustion in this piece. Punctuated with subtle yet deliberate, almost mechanised camera moves and cut in a very subdued fashion, this piece will be predominantly shot with a macro lens and will also be given a highly colour saturated visual treatment in post production.

group_siblings.title: Tag
group_siblings.creator_credit: Amiel Courtin-Wilson

results.title: Tag
results.brief_description: This proposed public imaging project shows a middle-aged woman standing in the middle of a well-furnished lounge room, wearing only her underwear and a blindfold. Other middle-aged people stand around her, also in their underwear, as she tries to find them while blindfolded. Bumping into things, tripping over furniture and laughing in the process- we follow the game from room to room as the woman in the blindfold tries to catch the various people taunting her. Finally tagging a younger man in the kitchen, the woman rips off the blindfold to see who she has caught. The image then cuts to static briefly and we start the game again, only this time with the man that was found or “tagged” now wearing the blindfold. This process repeats a number of times until most people at the party have been blindfolded. Stylistically, the video material will be a mixture of handheld home video cinematography juxtaposed with locked-off tripod material shot with multiple video cameras. The video imagery will then be degraded and transferred to 16mm- the final, highly textured imagery resembling a badly tuned television broadcast of surveillance camera footage.
